ygData.msgSnippet: As the door swung open, Nightshift scoots in like a cat trying to get out of the house.Â  He motions Batscout with his tail as he does so, darting in, keeping

Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

As the door swung open, Nightshift scoots in like a cat trying to get out o=
f the house.=C2=A0 He motions Batscout with his tail as he does so, darting=
 in, keeping his body low to the ground, padding on silent paws.=C2=A0 With=
out a sound he hides in the darkness of the shadows, and crouches in a corn=
er of the room, lying motionless.=C2=A0 He then texts Wolfgang.
=C2=A0
"Nev=
er mind, I'm in, door just opened, so I took the opportunity when it came a=
vailable.=C2=A0 From here on out, text messages only.=C2=A0 No one knows I'=
m here, except for you guys.=C2=A0 Let's keep it that way."


_____________=
___________________
From: Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...>
To: nbwr=
pg@yahoogroups.com 
Sent: Monday, November 21, 2011 12:21 PM
Subject: Re: F=
rigid Callings


=C2=A0 
> <OLD>
>
> Nightshift retracts his paw from the d=
oor.
>
> " Good point, not gonna go that way. And I would keep this as quie=
t as
> possible. Sorry, no big guns chief, that's gonna make things messy.
=
> There's gotta be a kill switch somewhere. I bet if we find that, turn the=

> power grid off, and then move in, that'll buy us some time. Question is
=
> where the slag is the main switch board?"

<NEW>

The cave-like earthy sm=
ell of the tunnel was begining to die back as
noses and olfactory sensors b=
egan to adjust for it, but there was
still the feeling of moisture in the a=
ir, one of dank humidity. Not
enough to worry anyone, but enough to remind =
anyone in the tunnel that
above them was a rather large lake, one that coul=
d easily crush any of
them should it come down around them.

"Well you tell=
 me?" WOLFGANG transmitted to NIGHTSHIFT. "You are on
the outside of the ba=
se trying to get in and the door is locked, where
would you put the one swi=
tch that could disable the security holding
the door?"

There was humor in =
WOLFGANG's voice, but what he was saying was
obvious: No one would put a ki=
ll switch on this side of the door
because then anyone could simply pull it=
 and enter without needing the
passcodes.

However having said all that the=
 locking mechanism on the door clicked
once and then turned and the door be=
gan to swing open.

(TAG)

- Preston
